name: Early Blight
description: Early blight is a common fungal disease affecting tomatoes. It appears as dark brown spots with concentric rings on older leaves, eventually causing leaf yellowing and drop.
symptoms: Dark brown spots with concentric rings (target-like)
Leaf drop starting from bottom of plant
spread: Spreads by wind-blown spores, water splash, and contaminated tools

name: Late Blight
description: Late blight is a devastating disease that can destroy entire potato crops within days. It's the same disease that caused the Irish Potato Famine.
symptoms: White fungal growth on leaf undersides
Rapid browning and death of foliage
spread: Spreads rapidly by airborne spores, especially in wet weather

name: Northern Leaf Blight
description: Northern leaf blight is a fungal disease causing long, cigar-shaped lesions on corn leaves, reducing photosynthetic area and yield.
symptoms: Start on lower leaves, progress upward
Reduced yield due to premature leaf death
spread: Wind-blown spores from infected crop debris

name: Apple Scab
description: Apple scab is the most serious disease of apple trees, causing dark, scabby lesions on leaves and fruit.
symptoms: Olive-green to brown spots on leaves
spread: Spores released from fallen leaves, spread by rain splash

name: Black Rot
description: Black rot is a serious fungal disease of grapes causing complete fruit loss if not controlled.
symptoms: Circular tan spots with dark border on leaves
Dark lesions on shoots and tendrils
Berries shrivel and turn into mummies
spread: Rain splash from mummified berries and infected plant debris
